title: 113_s2770
content: The Act is titled the "Open Book on Equal Access to Justice Act" and it modifies provisions related to equal access to justice. The Open Book on Equal Access to Justice Act amends Section 504 of title 5, United States Code, requiring the Chairman of the Administrative Conference of the United States to submit an annual report on fees and expenses awarded under this section to Congress and publicly available online. The Open Book on Equal Access to Justice Act amends Section 504 of title 5, United States Code, requiring the Chairman of the Administrative Conference of the United States to submit an annual report on fees and expenses awarded under this section to Congress and publicly available online. The report should include details on the nature, amount, and claims involved in the controversy, as well as a searchable database created and maintained by the Chairman. The United States will maintain a searchable database on a website with details of each award of fees and expenses under the Open Book on Equal Access to Justice Act. This includes the case name, agency involved, description of claims, and recipient information. The Open Book on Equal Access to Justice Act requires agencies to provide details of fee awards to the Chairman of the Administrative Conference of the United States for a searchable database. The database must not disclose prohibited information by law or court order. Additionally, court cases under this Act must report fee awards annually to the Chairman. The Access to Justice Act mandates the submission of an annual report on fees and expenses awarded, including details on the number, nature, and amount of awards, claims involved, and any relevant information for Congress evaluation. Reports must also include payments made through settlement agreements. The Chairman of the Administrative Conference of the United States must include in each annual report details of fees and expenses awarded in cases, including any payments made under settlement agreements. The Chairman of the Administrative Conference of the United States will maintain a searchable database on an Internet website with information on awards of fees and expenses, including case names, agency names, and statements for individual awards. The database will not reveal any prohibited information and agencies must provide requested information promptly. Technical amendments are made to Section 2412 of title 28, United States Code, including changes to subsections (d)(3) and (e) to comply with the Chairman's information requests.
